name: qt

conflicts.name: +webkit
conflicts.description: qt: qtwebengine@5.7:5.15 are based on Google Chromium versions which depend on Py2

conflicts.name: +framework
conflicts.description: qt: QT cannot be built as a framework except on macOS.

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: framework
variants.description: Build as a macOS Framework package.

variants.name: gui
variants.description: Build the Qt GUI module and dependencies

description: Qt is a comprehensive cross-platform C++ application framework.

dependencies.name: assimp
dependencies.description:
Open Asset Import Library (Assimp) is a portable Open Source library to
import various well-known 3D model formats in a uniform manner.

dependencies.name: bison
dependencies.description:
Bison is a general-purpose parser generator that converts an annotated
context-free grammar into a deterministic LR or generalized LR (GLR)
parser employing LALR(1) parser tables.

dependencies.name: dbus
dependencies.description:
D-Bus is a message bus system, a simple way for applications to talk to
one another. D-Bus supplies both a system daemon (for events such new
hardware device printer queue ) and a per-user-login-session daemon (for
general IPC needs among user applications). Also, the message bus is
built on top of a general one-to-one message passing framework, which
can be used by any two applications to communicate directly (without
going through the message bus daemon).

dependencies.name: double-conversion
dependencies.description:
This project (double-conversion) provides binary-decimal and decimal-
binary routines for IEEE doubles. The library consists of efficient
conversion routines that have been extracted from the V8 JavaScript
engine. The code has been refactored and improved so that it can be used
more easily in other projects. There is extensive documentation in
src/double-conversion.h. Other examples can be found in
test/cctest/test-conversions.cc.

dependencies.name: flex
dependencies.description: Flex is a tool for generating scanners.

dependencies.name: fontconfig
dependencies.description: Fontconfig is a library for configuring/customizing font access

dependencies.name: freetype
dependencies.description:
FreeType is a freely available software library to render fonts. It is
written in C, designed to be small, efficient, highly customizable, and
portable while capable of producing high-quality output (glyph images)
of most vector and bitmap font formats.

dependencies.name: gettext
dependencies.description: GNU internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n) library.

dependencies.name: gl
dependencies.description: Shim package for the GLX library.

dependencies.name: glib
dependencies.description:
GLib provides the core application building blocks for libraries and
applications written in C. The GLib package contains a low-level
libraries useful for providing data structure handling for C,
portability wrappers and interfaces for such runtime functionality as an
event loop, threads, dynamic loading and an object system.

dependencies.name: gperf
dependencies.description:
GNU gperf is a perfect hash function generator. For a given list of
strings, it produces a hash function and hash table, in form of C or C++
code, for looking up a value depending on the input string. The hash
function is perfect, which means that the hash table has no collisions,
and the hash table lookup needs a single string comparison only.

dependencies.name: gtkplus
dependencies.description:
The GTK+ package contains libraries used for creating graphical user
interfaces for applications.

dependencies.name: harfbuzz
dependencies.description: The Harfbuzz package contains an OpenType text shaping engine.

dependencies.name: icu4c
dependencies.description:
ICU is a mature, widely used set of C/C++ and Java libraries providing
Unicode and Globalization support for software applications. ICU4C is
the C/C++ interface.

dependencies.name: inputproto
dependencies.description:
X Input Extension. This extension defines a protocol to provide
additional input devices management such as graphic tablets.

dependencies.name: jpeg
dependencies.description:
libjpeg is a widely used free library with functions for handling the
JPEG image data format. It implements a JPEG codec (encoding and
decoding) alongside various utilities for handling JPEG data.

dependencies.name: libdrm
dependencies.description:
A userspace library for accessing the DRM, direct rendering manager, on
Linux, BSD and other systems supporting the ioctl interface.

dependencies.name: libmng
dependencies.description:
THE reference library for reading, displaying, writing and examining
Multiple-Image Network Graphics. MNG is the animation extension to the
popular PNG image format.

dependencies.name: libpng
dependencies.description: libpng is the official PNG reference library.

dependencies.name: libsm
dependencies.description: libSM - X Session Management Library.

dependencies.name: libtiff
dependencies.description: LibTIFF - Tag Image File Format (TIFF) Library and Utilities.

dependencies.name: libx11
dependencies.description: libX11 - Core X11 protocol client library.

dependencies.name: libxcb
dependencies.description:
The X protocol C-language Binding (XCB) is a replacement for Xlib
featuring a small footprint, latency hiding, direct access to the
protocol, improved threading support, and extensibility.

dependencies.name: libxcomposite
dependencies.description:
libXcomposite - client library for the Composite extension to the X11
protocol.

dependencies.name: libxcursor
dependencies.description: libXcursor - X Window System Cursor management library.

dependencies.name: libxdamage
dependencies.description: This package contains the library for the X Damage extension.

dependencies.name: libxext
dependencies.description: libXext - library for common extensions to the X11 protocol.

dependencies.name: libxi
dependencies.description: libXi - library for the X Input Extension.

dependencies.name: libxkbcommon
dependencies.description:
xkbcommon is a library to handle keyboard descriptions, including
loading them from disk, parsing them and handling their state. It's
mainly meant for client toolkits, window systems, and other system
applications.

dependencies.name: libxml2
dependencies.description:
Libxml2 is the XML C parser and toolkit developed for the Gnome project
(but usable outside of the Gnome platform), it is free software
available under the MIT License.

dependencies.name: libxrandr
dependencies.description: libXrandr - X Resize, Rotate and Reflection extension library.

dependencies.name: libxrender
dependencies.description: libXrender - library for the Render Extension to the X11 protocol.

dependencies.name: libxtst
dependencies.description:
libXtst provides the Xlib-based client API for the XTEST & RECORD
extensions. The XTEST extension is a minimal set of client and server
extensions required to completely test the X11 server with no user
intervention. This extension is not intended to support general
journaling and playback of user actions. The RECORD extension supports
the recording and reporting of all core X protocol and arbitrary X
extension protocol.

dependencies.name: llvm
dependencies.description:
The LLVM Project is a collection of modular and reusable compiler and
toolchain technologies. Despite its name, LLVM has little to do with
traditional virtual machines, though it does provide helpful libraries
that can be used to build them. The name "LLVM" itself is not an
acronym; it is the full name of the project.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: nss
dependencies.description:
Network Security Services (NSS) is a set of libraries designed to
support cross-platform development of security-enabled client and server
applications. Applications built with NSS can support SSL v3, TLS, PKCS
#5, PKCS #7, PKCS #11, PKCS #12, S/MIME, X.509 v3 certificates, and
other security standards.

dependencies.name: openssl
dependencies.description:
OpenSSL is an open source project that provides a robust, commercial-
grade, and full-featured toolkit for the Transport Layer Security (TLS)
and Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocols. It is also a general-purpose
cryptography library.

dependencies.name: pcre
dependencies.description:
The PCRE package contains Perl Compatible Regular Expression libraries.
These are useful for implementing regular expression pattern matching
using the same syntax and semantics as Perl 5.

dependencies.name: pcre2
dependencies.description:
The PCRE2 package contains Perl Compatible Regular Expression libraries.
These are useful for implementing regular expression pattern matching
using the same syntax and semantics as Perl 5.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and
libraries

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: sqlite
dependencies.description:
SQLite is a C-language library that implements a small, fast, self-
contained, high-reliability, full-featured, SQL database engine.

dependencies.name: xcb-util-image
dependencies.description:
The XCB util modules provides a number of libraries which sit on top of
libxcb, the core X protocol library, and some of the extension
libraries. These experimental libraries provide convenience functions
and interfaces which make the raw X protocol more usable. Some of the
libraries also provide client-side code which is not strictly part of
the X protocol but which have traditionally been provided by Xlib.

dependencies.name: xcb-util-keysyms
dependencies.description:
The XCB util modules provides a number of libraries which sit on top of
libxcb, the core X protocol library, and some of the extension
libraries. These experimental libraries provide convenience functions
and interfaces which make the raw X protocol more usable. Some of the
libraries also provide client-side code which is not strictly part of
the X protocol but which have traditionally been provided by Xlib.

dependencies.name: xcb-util-renderutil
dependencies.description:
The XCB util modules provides a number of libraries which sit on top of
libxcb, the core X protocol library, and some of the extension
libraries. These experimental libraries provide convenience functions
and interfaces which make the raw X protocol more usable. Some of the
libraries also provide client-side code which is not strictly part of
the X protocol but which have traditionally been provided by Xlib.

dependencies.name: xcb-util-wm
dependencies.description:
The XCB util modules provides a number of libraries which sit on top of
libxcb, the core X protocol library, and some of the extension
libraries. These experimental libraries provide convenience functions
and interfaces which make the raw X protocol more usable. Some of the
libraries also provide client-side code which is not strictly part of
the X protocol but which have traditionally been provided by Xlib.

dependencies.name: zlib-api
dependencies.description: zlib replacement with optimizations for next generation systems.

dependencies.name: zstd
dependencies.description:
Zstandard, or zstd as short version, is a fast lossless compression
algorithm, targeting real-time compression scenarios at zlib-level and
better compression ratios.

dependent_to.name: qcachegrind
dependent_to.description:
{K,Q}Cachegrind is a KDE/Qt GUI to visualize profiling data. It's mainly
used as visualization frontend for data measured by Cachegrind/Callgrind
tools from the Valgrind package, but there are converters for other
measurement tools available. Also provides the command-line tool
'cgview'

dependent_to.name: libqglviewer
dependent_to.description:
libQGLViewer is a C++ library based on Qt that eases the creation of
OpenGL 3D viewers.

dependent_to.name: texstudio
dependent_to.description:
TeXstudio is a fully featured LaTeX editor, whose goal is to make
writing LaTeX documents as easy and comfortable as possible.

dependent_to.name: gxsview
dependent_to.description:
Gxsview is a stand-alone multi-platform integrated tool to visualize
input data of Monte Carlo radiation transport calculation code, MCNP5,
and PHITS3. It consists of 3D, 2D, cross-section, and input file
viewers. Also, this software is capable of exporting in 2D(png, jpg, and
xpm) or 3D(stl, vtk, vtp and ply) formats.

dependent_to.name: qwt
dependent_to.description:
The Qwt library contains GUI Components and utility classes which are
primarily useful for programs with a technical background. Beside a
framework for 2D plots it provides scales, sliders, dials, compasses,
thermometers, wheels and knobs to control or display values, arrays, or
ranges of type double.

dependent_to.name: qscintilla
dependent_to.description:
QScintilla is a port to Qt of Neil Hodgson's Scintilla C++ editor
control.

dependent_to.name: qtgraph
dependent_to.description:
The baseline library used in the CUDA-centric Open|SpeedShop Graphical
User Interface (GUI) which allows Graphviz DOT formatted data to be
imported into a Qt application by wrapping the Graphviz libcgraph and
libgvc within the Qt Graphics View Framework.

dependent_to.name: gatepet2stir
dependent_to.description: A QT/C++ application to convert GATE geometries to STIR format.

dependent_to.name: qwtpolar
dependent_to.description:
The QwtPolar library contains classes for displaying values on a polar
coordinate system.

dependent_to.name: cbtf-argonavis-gui
dependent_to.description:
CBTF Argo Navis GUI project contains the GUI that views OpenSpeedShop
performance information by loading in the Sqlite database files.
